p: Still more efforts are required from the agriculture and health extension officers to encourage production and utilization of OFSP connecting households with young children in pastoral areas of VAD populations (Low et al., 2007). Prolonged storage of OFSP is usually achieved by drying (sun drying), and during the traditional drying (sun drying) techniques, microbial contamination was reported as the major problem due to the high moisture content of the fresh OFSP. Amajor et al. ( 2014) reported that OFSP flours can produce by sun drying and milling of the fresh OFSP roots. OFSP flour prepared by milling of dried slices can also utilize as entire flour or as a combined with others.
